apiKey.name: x-api-key
apiKey.description: The API key to authenticate requests.

hidden.description: Whether to hide the picture from the resume.

url.description: The URL to the picture to display on the resume. Must be a valid URL with a protocol (http:// or https://).

size.description: The size of the picture to display on the resume, defined in points (pt).

rotation.description: The rotation of the picture to display on the resume, defined in degrees (Â°).

aspectRatio.description: The aspect ratio of the picture to display on the resume, defined as width / height (e.g. 1.5 for 1.5:1 or 0.5 for 1:2).

borderRadius.description: The border radius of the picture to display on the resume, defined in points (pt).

borderColor.description: The color of the border of the picture to display on the resume, defined as rgba(r, g, b, a).

borderWidth.description: The width of the border of the picture to display on the resume, defined in points (pt).

shadowColor.description: The color of the shadow of the picture to display on the resume, defined as rgba(r, g, b, a).

shadowWidth.description: The width of the shadow of the picture to display on the resume, defined in points (pt).

picture.description: Configuration for photograph displayed on the resume

name.description: The full name of the author of the resume.

headline.description: The headline of the author of the resume.

email.description: The email address of the author of the resume.

phone.description: The phone number of the author of the resume.

location.description: The location of the author of the resume.

url.description: The URL to show as a link. Must be a valid URL with a protocol (http:// or https://).

label.description: The label to display for the URL. Leave blank to display the URL as-is.

website.description: The website of the author of the resume.

id.description: The unique identifier for the custom field. Usually generated as a UUID.

icon.description: The icon to display for the custom field. Must be a valid icon name from @phosphor-icons/web icon set, or an empty string to hide. Default to '' (empty string) when unsure which icons are available.

text.description: The text to display for the custom field.

link.description: If the custom field should be a link, the URL to link to.

customFields.description: The custom fields to display on the resume.

basics.description: Basic information about the author, such as name, email, phone, location, and website

title.description: The title of the summary of the resume.

columns.description: The number of columns the summary should span across.

hidden.description: Whether to hide the summary from the resume.

content.description: The content of the summary of the resume. This should be a HTML-formatted string.

summary.description: Summary section of the resume, useful for a short bio or introduction

columns.description: The number of columns the section should span across.

hidden.description: Whether to hide the section from the resume.

id.description: The unique identifier for the item. Usually generated as a UUID.

hidden.description: Whether to hide the item from the resume.

showLinkInTitle.description: If true, the website URL is rendered as a hyperlink on the title instead of a separate link at the bottom.

icon.description: The icon to display for the custom field. Must be a valid icon name from @phosphor-icons/web icon set, or an empty string to hide. Default to '' (empty string) when unsure which icons are available.

network.description: The name of the network or platform.

username.description: The username of the author on the network or platform.

url.description: The URL to show as a link. Must be a valid URL with a protocol (http:// or https://).

label.description: The label to display for the URL. Leave blank to display the URL as-is.

website.description: The link to the profile of the author on the network or platform, if any.

items.description: The items to display in the profiles section.

profiles.description: The section to display the profiles of the author.

columns.description: The number of columns the section should span across.

hidden.description: Whether to hide the section from the resume.

hidden.description: Whether to hide the item from the resume.

showLinkInTitle.description: If true, the website URL is rendered as a hyperlink on the title instead of a separate link at the bottom.

position.description: The position held at the company or organization.

location.description: The location of the company or organization.

period.description: The period of time the author was employed at the company or organization.

level.description: The proficiency level of the skill, defined as a number between 0 and 5. If set to 0, the icons displaying the level will be hidden.

keywords.description: The keywords associated with the skill, if any. These are displayed as tags below the name.

name.description: The name of the reference, or a note such as 'Available upon request'.

position.description: The position or job title of the reference.

url.description: The URL to show as a link. Must be a valid URL with a protocol (http:// or https://).

label.description: The label to display for the URL. Leave blank to display the URL as-is.

website.description: The website or LinkedIn profile of the reference, if any.

phone.description: The phone number of the reference.

description.description: The description of the reference. Can be used to display a quote, a testimonial, etc. This should be a HTML-formatted string.

items.description: The items to display in the custom section. Items follow the schema of the section type.

customSections.description: Custom sections of the resume, such as a custom section for notes, etc.

template.description: The template to use for the resume. Determines the overall design and appearance of the resume.

sidebarWidth.description: The width of the sidebar column, defined as a percentage of the page width.

fullWidth.description: Whether the layout of the page should be full width. If true, the main column will span the entire width of the page. This means that there should be no items in the sidebar column.

main.description: The items to display in the main column of the page. A string array of section IDs (experience, education, projects, skills, languages, interests, awards, certifications, publications, volunteer, references, profiles, summary or UUIDs for custom sections).

sidebar.description: The items to display in the sidebar column of the page. A string array of section IDs (experience, education, projects, skills, languages, interests, awards, certifications, publications, volunteer, references, profiles, summary or UUIDs for custom sections).

pages.description: The pages to display in the layout.

layout.description: The layout of the resume. Determines the structure and arrangement of the sections on the resume.

enabled.description: Whether to enable custom CSS for the resume.

value.description: The custom CSS to apply to the resume. This should be a valid CSS string.

css.description: Custom CSS to apply to the resume. Can be used to override the default styles of the template.

gapX.description: The horizontal gap between the sections of the page, defined in points (pt).

gapY.description: The vertical gap between the sections of the page, defined in points (pt).

marginX.description: The horizontal margin of the page, defined in points (pt).

marginY.description: The vertical margin of the page, defined in points (pt).

format.description: The format of the page. Can be 'a4', 'letter' or 'free-form'.

locale.description: The locale of the page. Used for displaying pre-translated section headings, if not overridden.

hideIcons.description: Whether to hide the icons of the sections.

page.description: The page settings of the resume. Determines the margins, format, and locale of the resume.

icon.description: The icon to display for the custom field. Must be a valid icon name from @phosphor-icons/web icon set, or an empty string to hide. Default to '' (empty string) when unsure which icons are available.

type.description: The type of the level design. 'hidden' will hide the level design, 'circle' will display a circle, 'square' will display a square, 'rectangle' will display a rectangle, 'rectangle-full' will display a full rectangle, 'progress-bar' will display a progress bar, and 'icon' will display an icon. If 'icon' is selected, the icon to display should be specified in the 'icon' field.

primary.description: The primary color of the design, defined as rgba(r, g, b, a).

text.description: The text color of the design, defined as rgba(r, g, b, a). Usually set to black: rgba(0, 0, 0, 1).

background.description: The background color of the design, defined as rgba(r, g, b, a). Usually set to white: rgba(255, 255, 255, 1).

design.description: The design settings of the resume. Determines the colors, level designs, and typography of the resume.

fontFamily.description: The family of the font to use. Must be a font that is available on Google Fonts.

fontWeights.description: The weight of the font, defined as a number between 100 and 900. Default to 400 when unsure if the weight is available in the font.

fontSize.description: The size of the font to use, defined in points (pt).

lineHeight.description: The line height of the font to use, defined as a multiplier of the font size (e.g. 1.5 for 1.5x).

body.description: The typography for the body of the resume.

fontFamily.description: The family of the font to use. Must be a font that is available on Google Fonts.

fontWeights.description: The weight of the font, defined as a number between 100 and 900. Default to 400 when unsure if the weight is available in the font.

fontSize.description: The size of the font to use, defined in points (pt).

lineHeight.description: The line height of the font to use, defined as a multiplier of the font size (e.g. 1.5 for 1.5x).

heading.description: The typography for the headings of the resume.

typography.description: The typography settings of the resume. Determines the fonts and sizes of the body and headings of the resume.

notes.description: Personal notes for the resume. Can be used to add any additional information or instructions for the resume. These notes are not displayed on the resume, they are only visible to the author of the resume when editing the resume. This should be a HTML-formatted string.

metadata.description: Metadata for the resume, such as template, layout, typography, etc. This section describes the overall design and appearance of the resume.

post.description: Validates the connection to an AI provider by sending a simple test prompt. Requires the provider type, model name, API key, and an optional base URL. Supported providers: OpenAI, Anthropic, Google Gemini, Ollama, and Vercel AI Gateway. Requires authentication.

200.description: The AI provider connection was successful.

message.default: The AI provider returned an error or is unreachable.

post.summary: Parse a PDF file into resume data
post.description: Extracts structured resume data from a PDF file using the specified AI provider. The file should be sent as a base64-encoded string along with AI provider credentials. Returns a complete ResumeData object. Requires authentication.

200.description: The PDF was successfully parsed into structured resume data.

message.default: The AI provider returned an error or is unreachable.

post.summary: Parse a DOCX file into resume data
post.description: Extracts structured resume data from a DOCX or DOC file using the specified AI provider. The file should be sent as a base64-encoded string along with AI provider credentials and the document's media type. Returns a complete ResumeData object. Requires authentication.

200.description: The DOCX was successfully parsed into structured resume data.

message.default: The AI provider returned an error or is unreachable.

post.summary: Chat with AI to modify resume
post.description: Streams a chat response from the configured AI provider. The LLM can call the patch_resume tool to generate JSON Patch operations that modify the resume. Requires authentication and AI provider credentials.

200.description: OK

get.description: Returns a list of all authentication providers enabled on this Reactive Resume instance, along with their display names. Possible providers include password-based credentials, Google, GitHub, and custom OAuth. No authentication required.

200.description: A map of enabled authentication provider identifiers to their display names.

delete.description: Permanently deletes the authenticated user's account, including all resumes, uploaded files (profile pictures, screenshots, PDFs), and associated data. This action is irreversible. Requires authentication.

200.description: The user account and all associated data have been successfully deleted.

get.description: Returns the current feature flags for this Reactive Resume instance. Feature flags control instance-wide settings such as whether new user signups or email-based authentication are disabled. No authentication required.

200.description: The current feature flags for this instance.

disableSignups.description: Whether new user signups are disabled on this instance.

disableEmailAuth.description: Whether email-based authentication is disabled on this instance.

get.description: Returns a sorted list of all unique tags across the authenticated user's resumes. Useful for populating tag filters in the dashboard. Requires authentication.

200.description: A sorted array of unique tag strings.

get.description: Returns view and download statistics for the specified resume, including total counts and the timestamps of the last view and download. Requires authentication.

schema.description: The unique identifier of the resume.

200.description: The resume's view and download statistics.

isPublic.description: Whether the resume is currently public.

views.description: Total number of times the resume has been viewed.

downloads.description: Total number of times the resume has been downloaded.

lastViewedAt.description: Timestamp of the last view, or null if never viewed.

lastDownloadedAt.description: Timestamp of the last download, or null if never downloaded.

get.description: Returns a list of all resumes belonging to the authenticated user. Results can be filtered by tags and sorted by last updated date, creation date, or name. Resume data is not included in the response for performance; use the get endpoint to fetch full resume data. Requires authentication.

200.description: A list of resumes with their metadata (without full resume data).

id.description: The ID of the resume.

createdAt.description: The date and time the resume was created.

updatedAt.description: The date and time the resume was last updated.

post.description: Creates a new resume with the given name, slug, and tags. Optionally initializes the resume with sample data by setting withSampleData to true. The slug must be unique across the user's resumes. Returns the ID of the newly created resume. Requires authentication.

200.description: The ID of the newly created resume.

schema.description: The ID of the created resume.

message.default: A resume with this slug already exists.

get.description: Returns a single resume with its full data, identified by its unique ID. Only resumes belonging to the authenticated user can be retrieved. Requires authentication.

200.description: The resume with its full data.

id.description: The ID of the resume.

put.description: Updates one or more fields of a resume identified by its ID. All fields are optional; only provided fields will be updated. Locked resumes cannot be updated. Requires authentication.

200.description: The updated resume with its full data.

id.description: The ID of the resume.

message.default: A resume with this slug already exists.

patch.description: Applies JSON Patch (RFC 6902) operations to partially update a resume's data. This allows small, targeted changes (e.g. updating a single field) without sending the entire resume object. Locked resumes cannot be patched. Requires authentication.

schema.description: The ID of the resume to patch.

operations.description: An array of JSON Patch (RFC 6902) operations to apply to the resume data.

200.description: The patched resume with its full data.

id.description: The ID of the resume.

message.default: The patch operations are invalid or produced an invalid resume.

delete.description: Permanently deletes a resume and its associated files (screenshots, PDFs) from storage. Locked resumes cannot be deleted; unlock the resume first. Requires authentication.

200.description: The resume and its associated files were deleted successfully.

get.summary: Get public resume by username and slug
get.description: Returns a publicly shared resume identified by the owner's username and the resume's slug. If the resume is password-protected and the viewer has not yet verified the password, a 401 error with code NEED_PASSWORD is returned. No authentication required for public resumes; if authenticated as the owner, private resumes are also accessible.

200.description: The public resume with its full data.

id.description: The ID of the resume.

post.description: Creates a new resume from an existing ResumeData object (e.g. from a previously exported JSON file). A random name and slug are generated automatically. Returns the ID of the imported resume. Requires authentication.

200.description: The ID of the imported resume.

schema.description: The ID of the imported resume.

message.default: A resume with this slug already exists.

post.description: Toggles the locked status of a resume. When locked, a resume cannot be updated, patched, or deleted. Useful for protecting finalized resumes from accidental edits. Requires authentication.

200.description: The resume lock status was updated successfully.

put.description: Sets or updates a password on a resume. When a password is set, viewers of the public resume must enter the password before the resume data is revealed. The password must be between 6 and 64 characters. Requires authentication.

200.description: The resume password was set successfully.

delete.description: Removes password protection from a resume. After removal, the resume (if public) can be viewed without entering a password. Requires authentication.

200.description: The resume password was removed successfully.

post.description: Verifies a password for a password-protected public resume. On success, the viewer is granted access to view the resume data for the duration of their session. No authentication required.

schema.description: The username of the resume owner.

200.description: The password was verified successfully and access has been granted.

post.description: Creates a copy of an existing resume with the same data. Optionally override the name, slug, and tags for the duplicate. If not provided, the original resume's name, slug, and tags are used. Returns the ID of the duplicated resume. Requires authentication.

200.description: The ID of the duplicated resume.

schema.description: The ID of the duplicated resume.

get.description: Generates a PDF from the specified resume and uploads it to storage. Returns a URL to download the generated PDF file. If the request is made by an unauthenticated user (e.g. via a public share link), the resume's download count is incremented. Authentication is optional.

schema.description: The unique identifier of the resume to export.

200.description: The PDF was generated successfully. Returns a URL to download the file.

url.description: The URL to download the generated PDF file.

get.description: Returns a URL to a screenshot image of the first page of the specified resume. Screenshots are cached for up to 6 hours and regenerated automatically when the resume is updated. Returns null if the screenshot cannot be generated. Requires authentication.

schema.description: The unique identifier of the resume.

200.description: The screenshot URL, or null if the screenshot could not be generated.

url.description: The URL to the screenshot image, or null.

get.description: Returns the total number of registered users on this Reactive Resume instance. The count is cached for up to 6 hours for performance. No authentication required.

200.description: The total number of registered users.

schema.description: The total number of registered users.

get.description: Returns the total number of resumes created on this Reactive Resume instance. The count is cached for up to 6 hours for performance. No authentication required.

200.description: The total number of resumes created.

schema.description: The total number of resumes created.

get.description: Returns the number of GitHub stars for the Reactive Resume repository. The count is cached for up to 6 hours and falls back to a last-known value if the GitHub API is unavailable. No authentication required.

200.description: The number of GitHub stars for the Reactive Resume repository.
